benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/customFields - Remove custom fields from account

covered: Valid Deletion: Multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC13, TC14, TC15, TC18) cover successful deletion of all or specific custom fields.
Non-Existent Resource: TC06 covers deletion attempts on non-existent accounts with expected 204 response.
Concurrency: TC15 covers repeated deletion of the same custom field ensuring idempotency.
Input Validation: TC05, TC08, TC19, TC20 cover invalid accountId formats, invalid customField UUIDs, and security injection attempts.
Authorization: TC10 tests unauthorized access with expected 401/403 responses.
Optional Headers: TC03 tests handling of optional headers X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment.
Error Handling: TC11 and TC12 cover system errors and network timeouts.
Edge Cases: TC04 (no custom fields), TC09 (extra unsupported query params), TC14 (duplicate customField IDs), TC13 (max allowed custom fields), TC18 (partially populated accounts) are covered.
Performance: TC16 tests performance under peak load.
Integration: TC17 verifies data consistency after deletion.
gaps: Soft Deletes: No explicit test to verify if deletion is soft (marked deleted) or hard (permanent removal).
Rate Limiting: No tests cover handling of multiple rapid requests or throttling beyond TC16 concurrency test.
Request Body Validation: Although the API does not expect a request body, no test explicitly verifies behavior if a body is sent.
Header Validation Beyond Required: No tests for invalid or malformed X-Killbill-CreatedBy header values beyond missing header.
Response Content-Type: No explicit tests verify response content-type headers or JSON structure in error responses.
Caching Behavior: No tests verify caching headers or behavior post-deletion.
recommendations: Add tests to verify if deletion is soft or hard and the system behavior accordingly.
Include rate limiting tests to ensure the API handles excessive requests gracefully.
Add tests to verify behavior when a request body is sent with DELETE, even if not expected.
Test invalid or malformed X-Killbill-CreatedBy header values to ensure robust header validation.
Include assertions on response content-type headers and error response JSON structure.
Add tests to verify caching headers and behavior after deletion to ensure clients do not serve stale data.
